PropertyInputs module¶

Created on Mon Jan 13 21:03:30 2020

@author: young

PropertyInputs.f_keys_z()¶

returns the index/keys for z axis

PropertyInputs.f_seasonal_inp(inp, numpy=False, axis=0, level=0)¶

This function adjust treats the seasonal axis. Either returning inputs for the static model or DSP.

For numpy z axis can be any but for pandas z must be column (if you want to change this the function will need mods).

For the static model the inputs which are seasonally effected can be generated by 2 methods:

  1. Take the weighted average of the inputs for different seasons

  2. Take the first slice of the z axis which is the user defined ‘typical’ season.

Parameters

  • axis – the axis number where z is

  • level – for pandas which level is season (if multi index)

Returns

PropertyInputs.f_z_prob()¶

calc the prob of each active season

PropertyInputs.property_inp_sa()¶

None.

Applies sensitivity adjustment to each input. This function gets called at the beginning of each loop in the exp.py module
